result.execSummary:
The defendant Guy E Mountain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Guy E Mountain is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Guy E Mountain was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Guy E Mountain was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to defendant re: payment of atty fees
Order for payment of attorney fees in casenos:  14 CF 571, 14 CM 477, and 14 CM 458 per statement for services submitted by Atty Bennett on 9-25-15
ADA Genda requests JOC be amended
Filed by Atty Mark Bennett
Filed by Atty Mark Bennett

Defendant Guy E Mountain in court with attorney Mark H Bennett.   ADA Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived on Amended Information.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2&8. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. On ct. 8, Court imposed 4 yrs. prison consisting of 2 yrs. confinement, 2 yrs. extended supervision, stayed it & placed defendant on 5 yr. probation with conds. On count 2, Court imposed 6 months jail, concurrent with count 8, stayed it, placed defendant on 1 yr. probation, conds: $518, $443 costs, pay during first 2 years of probation. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.   Maintain absolute sobriety, not go bars or taverns where alcohol sold for on-site consumption. Submit DNA sample. Complete psychological evaluation and comply with follow up. Not possess any firearms.  Anger management if agent deems necessary. Pursue GED or equivalent, full-time work, schooling or treatment, or counseling as recommended by agent. No contact co-defendants: Mark Girton and Darius Brown. No contact with Top Hat Motel and victim. Periodic review in one year. Counts 1&3 dismissed. 14CM458 & 14CM477 dismissed. Court granted 192 days jail credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-20-2015 11:00 am
Jury trial at 11-19-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Guy E Mountain in court, in custody pro se, by jail video, motioned for reduced bond.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questioned defendant about his ability to post bond. State objected to reduction of bond.  Court denied defendant's motion. Bond continued.  Court granted petition for atty. No reimbursement ordered. Update to be done every 90 days of defendant's financial status. When tribal trust fund money is available, defendant to make payments toward his attorney. Court appt'd. Atty. Mark Bennett to all three cases. 14CM458 & 14CM477 track with.
